French appeals court orders Sarkozy's release from jail
subhead: A Paris appeals court decided that the former French president will be released from prison and placed under judicial supervision, pending an appeals trial over Libyan funding due to take place in March.

title: US government shutdown: Democrats split in the Senate, paving the way to end budget deadlock
Trump pardons Giuliani, allies accused of attempting to overturn 2020 election
Among France's centrists, Macron's succession is still anyone's game
subhead: A year and a half ahead of the 2027 presidential election, no 'natural' candidate has managed to dominate the fractured former majority coalition. Edouard Philippe, the only declared candidate, has distanced himself from Emmanuel Macron, while Gabriel Attal has held back.

title: BBC chief Tim Davie resigns after alleged Trump documentary scandal
subhead: Davie resigned on Sunday after accusations that one of the BBC's documentaries had edited a speech by Trump in a misleading way. The criticism emerged over clips spliced together from sections of a Trump speech on January 6, 2021. The UK culture, media and sport minister called the allegations 'incredibly serious.'

title: Israelis grapple with the unspoken questions of the postwar era
subhead: As the 2026 legislative elections approach, Israeli society faces deep divisions between an increasingly security-focused far right and a left tempted by emigration.

title: France faces younger, less experienced and more unpredictable jihadist threat
subhead: Nearly 70% of terrorism-related arrests now involve people under 21, and two-thirds of attackers since 2020 were previously unknown to authorities. Since October 7, 2023, over half of all attacks or foiled plots have been linked to the war in Gaza.

subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Le Pen's RN has clearly positioned itself as the party of billionaires'
subhead: Having voted against the 'Zucman' wealth tax, Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National now openly presents itself as a right-wing party on every level: It is nationalist, anti-immigrant, extractivist and hyper-capitalist.

title: François Ozon: 'No matter how big or small the film, I have always followed my own desire'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a figure about a decisive moment in their life. As a child, the director of 'The Stranger' discovered the world through his father's Super 8 films.
